fields.summary: client gives SqlException for test callable.java and parameterMapping.java on zOS

creator.name: myrna
creator.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

reporter.name: myrna

comments.body:
This patch (derby1127.p1.diff.txt, derby1127.p1.stat.txt) fixes the encoding issue with date,time,timestamp that was the cause for the failures for these 2 tests on z/os.

On client  side, java.sql.Time, java.sql.Date, java.sql.Timestamp are converted to a char representation and then sent across as bytes to server. Server expects these bytes to have been encoded using UTF8. Client currently uses the default encoding. Thus on a client jvm where encoding is different from UTF8, the data sent to server results in not being in the expected format and error is thrown.

For set parameter calls, ie setDate etc, the client calls DateTime.dateToDateBytes etc where a String(char[]).getBytes() is used.  see methods in Request.java for writeDate,writeTimestamp,writeTime

Server side, the parameters sent on SQLDTA objects, are read and parameters are set on the statement in DRDAConnThread.readAndsetParams. If server does not receive the date, time, timestamp parameters in expected format, the following exception is raised.
> java.sql.SQLException: The syntax of the string representation of a datetime value is incorrect.

This patch fixes
-- the calls in DateTime to use correct UTF8 encoding as the server expects. 
-- adds these two tests (callable.java, parameterMapping.java) to encodingTests

Testing
-- code only affects client. I have run derbynetclientmats and derbynetmats on linux/ibm142 wiht no new failures.
-- ran encodingTests suite on jdk15/windows ok.
-- ran derbynetclientmats and derbynetmats on Z/OS OK.  There are still some more issues to resolve on z/os, but these 2 tests pass on z/os. (As an aside - after the fix to this issue - the datetime diffs got resolved in csPrepStmt and prepstmt but they were failing with a different diff, which is a test problem. There is an exisiting jira (DERBY972) for it. I will attach a separate patch for that. )

can someone please look at this patch. Thanks. 

-------------
Question:
Server expects the date,time,timestamp to be in a specific format and also encoded with UTF8. My question is should we specify CCSID for these types given that we are expecting them to be encoded in a specific format. On a parameter describe for input parameters, as I checked the flow in the debugger - I realized the server does not sent CCSID for timestamp values. We only send for char parameters.  

I looked at spec briefly in fdoc manual and didnt find anything specific about timestamp datatypes. I think maybe these would fall under the numeric character strings(?).  This needs to be investigated more along with areas mentioned in DERBY-877.

Earlier I had problems with generating javadoc because now we need Ant 1.6.5 ( thanks andrew ) 

I am attaching a new patch to fix some javadoc warnings. This patch Derby1127.p1_javadoc.diff.txt has the same code changs as in Derby1127.p1.diff.txt

Can someone look at this patch.  Thanks.

I am attaching a patch for 10.1 codeline for_10.1_derby1127.p1.diff.txt.

The internationalization work on client (that david is working on ) is not in 10.1 and I have not tried to add sqlstate and message ids for the changes here. The changes are similar to the derby1127.p1_javadoc.diff.txt except for the following. 
- for the errors thrown in Request.java - SqlException with an english message text  is used.  
E.g

+        catch (java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException uee) {
+            throw new SqlException(netAgent_.logWriter_, uee,
+                    "Date conversion exception " + uee.getMessage() + ". See attached Throwable.");
+        }

I hope that is reasonable (?).

svn stat
M      java\client\org\apache\derby\client\net\Request.java
M      java\client\org\apache\derby\client\am\DateTime.java

I ran derbyall on linux with ibm142 and there are no new failures. 

-- Ran these two tests on z/os and tests passed OK.
-- since there is no encodingTests suite in 10.1 codeline. I am attaching a NewTestEnc.java test to test this fix. 

To run this test
1)start server.
2)java -cp "C:/workghm/svnclient/ks10.1/classes;." -Dfile.encoding=UTF-16 NewTestEnc

Output:
without the fix, you should see a FAILS message with exception message as 
   F A I L S   = = = = = > T h e   s y n t a x   o f   t h e   s t r i n g   r e p r e s e n t a t i o n   o f   a   d a t e t i m e   v a l u e   i s   i n c o r r e c t .

---------------
Can someone please look at this. Thanks.

Please use this patch (for_10.1_derby1127.p1.v2.diff.txt)  for 10.1 codeline - a one line change from the previous 10.1 patch to use the SqlException constructor for timestamp consistent with the others.   Tests on z/os ran ok.  Thanks.

Fix checked in for both 10.1 (r396021) and trunk(10.2) - revision 395748. These two 
tests pass on Z/OS /ibm1.4.2 for both 10.1 and trunk.
